Key Match Events: Nurkic made the second of two free throws with 0.8 seconds left after getting fouled on an offensive rebound, lifting the Phoenix Suns to a 114-113 victory over the Dallas Mavericks
Kevin Durant scored 26 points, and Nurkic had 15 points and 10 rebounds
Daniel Gafford got Dallas even at 113 on an alley-oop dunk from Luka Doncic, who had 30 points, seven assists and seven rebounds
Royce O’Neale missed a runner in the lane in the final seconds, but Nurkic grabbed the rebound and was bumped by several Dallas defenders on a missed shot as the buzzer sounded
Gafford fouled out on the play
Doncic was short on a desperation 3-pointer at the buzzer
Post-Match Reflections: Suns: O’Neale was a big boost off the bench, with Phoenix reserves outscoring the Dallas bench 28-9 after a 23-9 edge in the first meeting
Mavericks: Gafford’s foul trouble came with frontcourt partner Dereck Lively II out because of a sprained shoulder. Dwight Powell was forced to play a season-high 25 minutes and had five fouls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Royce O’Neale scored 18 points for Phoenix
Devin Booker had 13 points and 12 assists
